planningTip: Tip: update the start date and progress of your applied controls to see them here.
scoringAssistantNoMatrixError: Please import a risk matrix from the libraries store to get access to this page
name: Name
referenceControlHelpText: This serves as a template and would override some fields values (category, CSF function, etc.)
currentRiskLevelPerScenario: Current risk level per risk scenario
residualRiskLevelPerScenario: Residual risk level per risk scenario
watchlistDescription: Items that have expired or will expire in the next 30 days
composerDescription: This will help you aggregate multiple components (perimeters) to get the compiled view on your risk. This is particularly useful for two use cases
composerDescription1: business intelligence approach to focus on a specific subset across different perimeter domains (eg. across divisions)
composerDescription2: you are interested in the risk assessment of a specific system, for which you need the risk assessment of the underlying components
orderdByRankingScore: Over the next 30 days and ordered by ranking score
rankingScoreDefintion: Ranking score is an adaptive metric that combines the information of effort and current risk level, and crosses it with the other data to assist you for the prioritization
assetsImpactedByTheRiskScenario: Assets impacted by the risk scenario
theExistingAppliedControlsToManageThisRi: The existing applied controls to manage this risk
currentRiskLevelGivenCurrentMeasures: The current risk level given the current applied controls
riskLevelWhenAllExtraMeasuresDone: The risk level when all extra measures are done
changePasswordText: You can change your password here. You'll need to log in with your new password after this operation
label: Label
skillLevelText: How technically skilled is this group of threat agents?
motiveText: How motivated is this group of threat agents to find and exploit this vulnerability?
opportunityText: What resources and opportunities are required for this group of threat agents to find and exploit this vulnerability?
opportunityChoice1: Full access or expensive resources required
sizeText: How large is this group of threat agents?
easeOfDiscoveryText: How easy is it for this group of threat agents to discover this vulnerability?
easeOfExploitText: How easy is it for this group of threat agents to actually exploit this vulnerability?
awarenessText: How well known is this vulnerability to this group of threat agents?
intrusionDetectionText: How likely is an exploit to be detected?
financialDamageText: How much financial damage will result from an exploit?
financialDamageChoice1: Less than the cost to fix the vulnerability
reputationDamageText: Would an exploit result in reputation damage that would harm the business?
nonComplianceText: How much exposure does non-compliance introduce?
privacyViolationText: How much personally identifiable information could be disclosed?
lossOfConfidentialityText: How much data could be disclosed and how sensitive is it?
lossOfConfidentialityChoice2: Minimal critical data or extensive non-sensitive data disclosed
lossOfIntegrityText: How much data could be corrupted and how damaged is it?
lossOfAvailabilityText: How much service could be lost and how vital is it?
lossOfAvailabilityChoice2: Minimal primary or extensive secondary services interrupted
lossOfAccountabilityText: Are the threat agents' actions traceable to an individual?

errorOccurredWhileLoadingLibrary: The following error occurred while loading the library form
confirmImportBackup: Are you sure you want to import this backup? This will overwrite all existing data inlcuding your actual credentials.

riskScenarioMeasureHelpText: The existing applied controls to manage this risk
currentRiskLevelHelpText: The risk level given the current measures
residualRiskLevelHelpText: The risk level when all the extra measures are done
composerHint: Hint: you can bookmark this page for future usage
composerTitle: Here is the overview for the selected risk assessment

forTheSelectedScope: For the selected scope, you have

effortHelpText: The effort required to implement the applied control
costHelpText: The cost required to implement the applied control
riskAcceptanceJusitficationHelpText: Justification for the risk acceptance. Only the approver can edit this field.
riskAcceptanceRiskScenariosHelpText: The risk scenarios that are accepted

riskAcceptanceSubmittingReviewMessage: This will be sent to the approver for validation.
riskAcceptanceValidatingReviewMessage: This risk acceptance is awaiting processing. Remember to review it before validating or rejecting it, you will not be able to go back.
riskAcceptanceValidatedMessage: This risk acceptance is currently validated. It can be revoked at any time, but this will be irrevocable. You will need to duplicate it with a different version if necessary.

setTemporaryPassword1: In case the user cannot set their own password, you can
setTemporaryPassword2: Please use a strong one and make sure to inform the user to change it as soon as possible

noThreatsMapped: No threats mapped. Consider attaching threats to your risk scenarios for a better overview.
actionPlanHelpText: The counter represents the number of associated requirements.
exportBackupDescription: This will serialize and create a backup of the database, including users and RBAC. Evidences and other files are not included in the backup.
importBackupDescription: This will deserialize and restore the database from a backup. This will overwrite all existing data, including users, RBAC and credentials and cannot be undone.
riskAssessmentInProgress: Risk assessment is still in progress
riskAssessmentNoAuthor: No author assigned to this risk assessment
riskAssessmentEmpty: Risk assessment is empty. No risk scenario declared yet
riskScenarioNoCurrentLevel: Current risk level has not been assessed
riskScenarioNoResidualLevel: Residual risk level has not been assessed. If no additional measures are applied, it should be at the same level as the current risk
riskScenarioResidualHigherThanCurrent: Residual risk level is higher than the current one
riskScenarioResidualProbaHigherThanCurre: Residual risk probability is higher than the current one
riskScenarioResidualImpactHigherThanCurr: Residual risk impact is higher than the current one
riskScenarioResidualLoweredWithoutMeasur: Residual risk level has been lowered without any specific measure
riskScenarioAcceptedNoAcceptance: Risk accepted but no risk acceptance attached
appliedControlETAInPast: ETA is in the past now. Consider updating its status or the date
appliedControlNoEffort: Does not have an estimated effort. This will help you for prioritization
appliedControlNoCost: Does not have an estimated cost. This will help you for prioritization
appliedControlNoLink: Applied control does not have an external link attached. This will help you for follow-up
riskAcceptanceExpired: Acceptance has expired. Consider updating the status or the date
complianceAssessmentNoAuthor: No author assigned to this audit
requirementAssessmentNoAppliedControl: Requirement assessment result is compliant or partially compliant with no applied control
appliedControlNoReferenceControl: Applied control has no reference control selected
requirementAppliedControlHelpText: Evidences linked to the selected measures will be automatically associated with the requirement.

secretHelpText: API secret, client secret, or consumer secret

idPInitiatedSSORejected: IdP initiated SSO rejected, please contact your administrator

ssoSettingsDescription: Configure your Single Sign-On settings here.
mappingInferenceTip: Mapping suggestion is available for this requirement
notApplicableScore: You cannot score if the requirement assessment is not applicable
logoHelpText: The logo will be displayed in the header of the application. Accepted formats are PNG, JPEG, WEBP, SVG.
faviconHelpText: The favicon will be displayed in the browser tab. Accepted formats are ICO, PNG, JPEG, WEBP, SVG.
waitingRiskAcceptances: Hello! You currently have {number} risk acceptance{s} pending. You can find them in the governance menu.
createAuditHelpText: Create an audit alongside the entity assessment

mailFailedToSend: The mail failed to be sent
successfullyUpdatedClientSettings: Client settings successfully updated, please refresh the page.

createAppliedControlsFromSuggestionsSucc: Applied controls successfully created from the suggested reference controls

createAppliedControlsFromSuggestionsConf: {count} applied controls will be created from the suggested reference controls. Do you want to proceed?
theFollowingControlsWillBeAddedColon: The following controls will be added:
couldNotFindAttachmentMessage: Could not find attachment file. Please contact your administrator.
licenseExpiredMessage: Your license has expired. Write operations are disabled. Please contact your administrator to renew it.
backupLoadingError: An error occurred while loading the backup.
backupVersionError: Can't load the backup, the version of the backup is invalid
backupGreaterVersionError: Can't load the backup, the version of the backup is higher than the current version of your application.
backupLowerVersionError: An error occurred, the backup version may be too old, if so it must be updated before retrying.
errorLicenseSeatsExceeded: The number of editor seats allowed by your license is exceeded, you will not be able to grant editing rights to this user. Please contact your administrator.
showImagesUnauthenticated: Show logo and favicon to unauthenticated users
showImagesUnauthenticatedHelpText: If disabled, the regular CISO Assistant logo and favicon will be displayed on the login screen
librariesCanOnlyBeLoadedByAdmin: Libraries can only be loaded by an administrator
fillSSOSLOURLx509cert: Option 2: Fill the SSO URL, SLO URL and x509cert
licenseAboutToExpireWarning: You have only {days_left} days before the end of your license.
emailPasswordMismatch: Unable to log in with provided credentials.
authenticatorAppDescription: Use an authenticator app to generate a time-based one-time password (TOTP) for two-factor authentication.
disableTOTPConfirm: Are you sure you want to disable two-factor authentication?
activateTOTPMessage: Scan the QR code with your authenticator app to activate two-factor authentication.
enterTOTPCodeManually: Enter the following code manually into the app
enterCodeGeneratedByApp: Enter the code generated by the authenticator app
listRecoveryCodesHelpText: Recovery codes are used to recover access to your account in case you lose access to your authenticator app. Keep these as safe as your password. We recommend storing them in a secure password manager.
errorRegeneratingRecoveryCodes: An error occurred while regenerating recovery codes
tooManyLoginAttempts: Too many login attempts. Please try again later.
securityObjectiveScaleHelpText: Choose your scale for security objectives (1 to 4 by default)
labelsHelpText: Labels are used to categorize and filter the items.
invalidLabel: Label must be alphanumeric and contain at most 36 characters
tagsHelpText: Labels help categorize and filter multiple objects. You can manage them on the Extra menu.
youCanSetPasswordHere: You can set your password here
mappingInferenceHelpText: These variables are fixed and will not change depending on the source.
privacyPublicData: Data Made Publicly Available by the Data Subject
privacyLegalClaims: Establishment, Exercise or Defense of Legal Claims
privacyDataTransferBindingRules: Transfer Subject to Binding Corporate Rules
privacyDataTransferDerogation: Transfer Based on Derogation for Specific Situations
ebiosWs2_1: Identify risk sources and targeted objectives
ebiosWs3_3: Define security measures for the ecosystem
ebiosWs4_2: Evaluate the likelihood of operational scenarios
ebiosRmMatrixHelpText: Risk matrix used as a reference for the study
bringTheEvidencesHelpText: If disabled, the object will be duplicated without its evidences
existingControlsHelper: What do you currently have to manage this risk
extraControlsHelper: What will you do to mitigate this risk
existingContextHelper: Description of the existing mitigations (this field will be deprecated soon)
resetPasswordHere: You can reset your password here.
errorAssetGraphMustNotContainCycles: The asset graph must not contain cycles.
errorFolderGraphMustNotContainCycles: The domain graph must not contain cycles.
goBackToEbiosRmStudy: Go back to Ebios RM study
nothingToShowYet: Nothing to show yet. Charts will be updated once you've started your audits.
ebiosWs2_2_tooltip: You need at least one RO/TO couple to evaluate it
ebiosWs2_3_tooltip: You need at least one RO/TO couple to select it
ebiosWs3_2_tooltip: You need at least one selected RO/TO couple to elaborate a strategic scenario
ebiosWs3_3_tooltip: You need at least one Stakeholder to define associated security measures
ebiosWs4_2_tooltip: You need at least one selected Attack Path from a Strategic Scenario to elaborate an operational scenario
ebiosWs4_3_tooltip: You need at least one Operational Scenario to evaluate its likelihood
ebiosWs5_tooltip: No risk assessment has been conducted yet
gravityHelpText: Estimating the level and intensity of the effects of a risk
likelihoodHelpText: Estimate of the feasibility or probability of a risk occurring
studyAssetHelpText: Primary (business asset) and supporting assets relating to the object under study
fearedEventHelpText: The feared events must express/translate the fears of the business
fearedEventAssetHelpText: Feared events are typically linked to business values (primary assets). Supporting assets are allowed here for flexibility.
fearedEventIsSelectedHelpText: Selection of the feared event for the study
riskOriginHelpText: Element, person, group of persons or organisation likely to generate a risk
targetObjectiveHelpText: Purpose of a source of risk, depending on its motivations
resourcesHelpText: Including financial resources, level of cyber skills, tools, time available to the attacker to carry out the attack, etc.
motivationHelpText: Interests, factors that drive the source of risk to achieve its objective
activityHelpText: What is the level of activity of the source of risk within the scope of the study?
pertinenceHelpText: The relevance of the source of risk to the target objective
roToIsSelectedHelpText: Selection of the RO/TO couple for the study
roToFearedEventHelpText: Confronting the most serious feared events
dependencyHelpText: Is the relationship with this stakeholder vital to my business?
penetrationHelpText: To what extent does the stakeholder have access to my internal resources?
maturityHelpText: What are the stakeholder's safety capabilities?
trustHelpText: Could the stakeholder's intentions or interests be contrary to my own?
stakeholderIsSelectedHelpText: Selection of the stakeholder for the study
strategicScenarioHelpText: Sets of attack paths from a source of risk to an intended target
operatingModesDescriptionHelpText: Description of a series of elementary actions. You can now provide the details of the kill chain in the next step. [!] Warning: This field will be obsolete soon.
operationalScenarioThreatsHelpText: Unitary actions carried out by a risk source on a critical supporting asset as part of an operational scenario
operationalScenarioIsSelectedHelpText: Selection of the operational scenario for the study
attackPathStakeholdersHelpText: Stakeholders involved in the attack path
attackPathIsSelectedHelpText: Selection of the attack path for the study
tourWelcomeDescription: Let's take a tour of the main features to get you started.
tourHelpButtonDescription: You can always restart this tour by clicking this button.
tourOrganizationDescription:
This is where you will define the hierarchy and perimeters of your organization.
Click on it.
tourDomainsDescription:
Domains allow you to isolate your objects using the associated roles. You will need at least one.
Click on it.
tourDomainAddDescription: This where you will be able to create a new domain.
tourPerimetersDescription:
Perimeters are functional sets within a domain. You will need at least one.
Click on it.
tourPerimeterAddDescription: This is where you will be able to create a perimeter.
tourCatalogDescription: The catalog is where you will be able to import frameworks, threats, matrices and other predifined objects
tourCatalogBrowseDescription:
You will be able to browse the loaded objects per category and import new ones.
Click on it.
tourFrameworksDescription:
View and manage compliance frameworks. You will need at least one to initiate an audit.
Click on it.
tourFrameworkAddDescription: This where you will be able to import new frameworks.
tourRiskMatricesDescription:
View and manage risk matrices. You will need at least one to initiate a risk assessment.
Click on it.
tourMatricesAddDescription: This is where you will be able to import new matrices.
tourComplianceDescription:
This where will be able to manage your compliance activities.
Click on it.
tourAuditsDescription: This is where you will be able to drive and track your audits and baselines
tourRiskDescription:
This is where you will be able to manage your risk analysis and registry.
Click on it.
tourRiskAssessmentDescription: Group and manage your analysis through risk assessments.
tourAnalyticsDescription:
The overview section cover your main dashboards and analytics.
Click on it.
tourAnalyticsViewDescription: View the aggregated analytics and reports here.
tourAssignmentsDescription: or track your indivdual assignements and tasks here.
tourHelpFinalDescription: Remember, you can always restart the tour from here!
useDocumentationScoreHelpText: A second score (the documentation score) will be available for scoring the requirements.
importFolderHelpText: Import a domain from a JSON or ZIP file
importVersionNotCompatibleWithCurrentVer: The import version is not compatible with the current version of the application
errorOccuredDuringImport: An error occurred during the import
missingLibrariesInImport: Some libraries are missing or not up-to-date, see the list above
loadMissingLibrariesHelpText: Load the missing libraries to complete the import if they are available.
firstTimeLoginModalDescription: This is your first time logging in. Would you like to take a guided tour to get started?
demoDataAlreadyImported: Demo data has already been imported. Delete or rename your existing DEMO domain.
noAuditForTheFramework: There is no audit using this framework
cannotDeleteAutoTimeline: Auto timeline entries cannot be deleted
author: Author
reauthenticateForSensitiveAction: The action you are trying to perform is sensitive and requires re-authentication
timestampCannotBeInTheFuture: Timestamp cannot be in the future
createRiskAssessment: Initiate a risk assessment as well
noDataAvailable: Not enough data for this visualisation. Refresh when more content is available.
etaOrCompletionDateHelpText: The date when the task is expected to be completed or was completed
completionDateHelpText: The date when the task was completed
isRecurrentHelpText: Check if the task is recurrent
taskDateHelpText: The task date or the start of its recurrence
reminderWarningStrategicScenarios: Reminder: Do not forget to identify Attacks Paths to do operational scenarios
addAttackPathToDoOperationalScenarios: You have to add an attack path to these strategic scenarios if you want to use them in the operational scenarios:
userIsNotSSO: SSO login is currently disabled for your account.
enableSSOHelpText: Enable SSO as a login option for all users.
keepLocalLoginHelpText: When global 'Force SSO' is enabled, this allows the user to bypass it and log in using a locally managed password if needed.
forceSSOLoginHelpText: Require SSO for all users and reset any saved passwords. Users with 'Exclude from forced SSO' enabled will retain password-based fallback access.
forceSSOLoginHelpText2: Ensure your SSO is functional or that you have a fallback account before enabling this option.
configureFeatureFlags: Configure feature flags to enable or disable specific features in the application.
featureFlagSettingsUpdated: Feature flag settings updated. Please refresh the page to apply the changes.
personalAccessTokensDescription: Tokens you have generated that can be used to access the CISO Assistant API.
personalAccessTokenCreateDescription: Personal Access Tokens (PATs) can be used instead of a password to authenticate to the API. They are useful for automating tasks or integrating with other systems.
personalAccessTokenCreateWarning: Warning: PATs are sensitive information. Treat them like passwords. If you lose a PAT, you will need to generate a new one.
personalAccessTokenOnlyDisplayedOnce: The token will only be displayed once. Make sure to copy it and store it securely.
personalAccessTokenExpiryHelpText: Number of days after which the token will expire
personalAccessTokenDeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this personal access token? Any applications or scripts using this token will no longer be able to access the CISO Assistant API. This action cannot be undone.
theFollowingChangesWillBeApplied: The following changes will be applied:
syncToAppliedControlsMessage: This audit requirements assessments will be synced to the status of the associated applied controls. Please note that this cannot be undone.
syncToAppliedControlsSuccess: Audit's requirements assessments synced to the associated applied controls
settingsRiskMatrixSwapAxesHelpText: Swaps the axes for probability and impact. When enabled, impact will be displayed on the vertical axis (ordinate), and probability on the horizontal axis (abscissa).
settingsRiskMatrixFlipVerticalHelpText: When enabled, the origin of the matrix will be in the top-left corner, with the Y axis increasing downward.
taskScheduleWarning: Any tasks that are not part of the new schedule will be permanently deleted
errorUpdatingObject: An error occurred while updating the {object} object.
reportedAtHelpText: Time stamp of the actual reporting
mappingSuggestedHelpText: Mapping suggestions based on loaded frameworks
mappingSuggestionTeasing: Mappings are now suggested! You can use the filters to explore suggestions based on loaded frameworks.
errorCreatingPersonalAccessToken: An error occurred while creating the personal access token.
errorMaxPatAmountExceeded: Maximum amount of tokens allowed exceeded for this user.
campaignDomainHelpText: The domain that the campaign will be attached to.
clientSecretAlreadySetHelpText: The client secret is already set.
oidcTokenAuthMethodHelpText: Optional token endpoint authentication method. If omitted, a method from the server's auth token method list is used
oidcPKCEEnabledHelpText: Enable OAuth PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) support. This is recommended for public clients.
dataWizardSelectFile: Select your file and make sure it matches the templates
dataWizardSelectFallbackDomain: Select a fallback Domain (if not set on the file)
inherentRiskLevelHelpText: The inherent risk level is the risk level before any controls are applied
antecedentsHelpText: Antecedents are not applicable for actions in the 'Know' stage, as they represent the initial steps of the attack path.
logicOperatorHelpText: Antecedents (two or more) can be grouped using logical operations.
ebiosOperationalScenarioHelp: Attack paths provide a high-level description of how a strategic scenario (from workshop 3) could unfold. While a strategic scenario may have multiple attack paths, each path translates into one operational scenario in workshop 4. You can then break down each operational scenario into multiple operating modes that combine elementary actions to describe a complete kill chain.
graphMoHelp: You can move the graph nodes to improve the rendering and reduce links crossover. It's better to have one killchain per operating mode for readibility and independent quotation.
defaultAssigneeHelpText: This user will be preset automatically as author for all assessments of this perimeter
